channel.title: Basics Of HTML
channel.description: Topic: How to HTML Difficulty: 5/10 Contents Language Simple Scripts Background Color Codes Fonts Ending Welcome to Drew's Amazing HTML TuT. This can make background games buttons browsers and many things in that topic. First will learn the language like all the words. = This is the first thing you type to start the script it tells the browser its starting an html = This is the LAST thing you type to end the script it tells the browser its ending an html = This beggining of the code you script into the html = Ends the above = Makes the text [b]bold[/b] = Ends the [b]bold[/b] text = Makes text [i]italic[/i] = Ends the above Well thats all we need to know for now. Let's start with a simple script HTML is hard to learn but useful when mastered. (Remember HTML is NOT case sensetive) This is my first HTML script That should come out as [b]This is[/b] my first [i]html[/i] script If you like i can add more like backgrounds that will be next [b]Backgrounds[/b] Backgrounds can be used for anything thats uses a background, websites browsers, anything. To make a background first you need a color code. A color code is a 6 digit number that tells the browser that it uses that color. It may take a long time to figure out your color you want to use. This is a simple background code Notice the "#" are the color codes. The BGCOLOR is the Font. That makes the background that color. This can be inserted anywhere in the script. [b]Color Codes[b] Ive explained color codes above but didn't get very far into it. Although yes they are 6 digit codes that tell the browser what color to display. The codes have anywhere from black to white to green to blue and every color you can imagine. [b]Fonts[/b] Fonts if you've ever made anything in Microsoft Word or anything like that you can change your font simply type the font into the begging e.g. TADA [b]Final Notes[/b] Now you've learned a few things (I hope...) Please post if this helped[br][size=1]Posted on: August 16, 2007, 02:59:31 AM[/size][hr]Come on leechers post if you read!

exe626:

I would consider HTML a script, although it is a code.

item.title: Basics Of HTML
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

Doesn’t really reach you anything, and the way you describe colors and such seems as if you need a tutorial on them yourself.

OnlyOneRule:

html isnt programing or scripting, more like coding

I would consider HTML a script, although it is a code.

HTML stands for the HyperText Markup Language. HTML code is the major language of the Internet's World Wide Web. Web sites and web pages are written in HTML code. With HTML code and the world wide web, you have the ability to bring together text, pictures, sounds, and links... all in one place! HTML code files are plain text files, so they can be composed and edited on any type of computer... Windows, Mac, UNIX, whatever.
Notice how much he says HTML code? kind of annoying to see it so much.

Uber edits: I recommend this tutorial HIGHLY above this one.

Read full topic

item.title: Basics Of HTML
item.dc:creator: @Drew_Scape Drew_Scape
item.description:
@Drew_Scape wrote:

Topic: How to HTML

Difficulty: 5/10

Contents
Language
Simple Scripts
Background
Color Codes
Fonts
Ending

Welcome to Drew’s Amazing HTML TuT. This can make background games buttons browsers and many things in
that topic. First will learn the language like all the words.

= This is the first thing you type to start the script it tells the browser its starting an html = This is the LAST thing you type to end the script it tells the browser its ending an html = This beggining of the code you script into the html = Ends the above = Makes the text [b]bold[/b] = Ends the [b]bold[/b] text = Makes text [i]italic[/i] = Ends the above

Well thats all we need to know for now. Let’s start with a simple script HTML is hard to learn but useful when mastered. (Remember HTML is NOT case sensetive)

This is my first HTML script

That should come out as

This is my first html script

If you like i can add more like backgrounds that will be next

Backgrounds

Backgrounds can be used for anything thats uses a background, websites browsers, anything. To make a background first you need a color code. A color code is a 6 digit number that tells the browser that it uses that color. It may take a long time to figure out your color you want to use. This is a simple background code

Notice the "#" are the color codes. The BGCOLOR is the Font. That makes the background that color. This can be inserted anywhere in the script.

[b]Color Codes[b]
Ive explained color codes above but didn’t get very far into it. Although yes they are 6 digit codes that tell the browser what color to display. The codes have anywhere from black to white to green to blue and every color you can imagine.

Fonts
Fonts if you’ve ever made anything in Microsoft Word or anything like that you can change your font simply type the font into the begging e.g. TADA

Final Notes
Now you’ve learned a few things (I hope…) Please post if this helped[br][size=1]Posted on: August 16, 2007, 02:59:31 AM[/size][hr]Come on leechers post if you read!

Read full topic
